review_text:
My week-long stay at Mike's Tinyhome in Sandpoint was an absolute delight! Despite its small size, the tiny home offered a cozy and warm atmosphere, even during cooler weather. The shower was nice and spacious, and the well-equipped kitchen made mornings a pleasure. Lounging with coffee and movies was a fantastic way to start the day.
While we didn't get a chance to use the barbecue and bicycles, their accessibility was appreciated. The outdoor lights created a lovely ambiance, and the loft area with its window overlooking the trees and sky was a unique and enjoyable experience.
Mike's guide to nearby activities and restaurants was a valuable resource, and the coffee provided was delicious, introducing us to a great coffee shop. The location of the tiny home was perfect, allowing us to walk around town, explore the beach, and enjoy nearby trails.
In summary, Mike's Tinyhome is a hidden gem in Sandpoint. I highly recommend it for a cozy and convenient stay. Thanks, Mike, for mak

Stayed with kids
review_text: We had the BEST stay in this adorable tiny house! My husband and I stayed there 2 nights with our 3yr-old son and 4yr-old daughter. The kids LOVED the upstairs bedroom loft (1 parent slept with them upstairs and the other on the super comfy futon). The hot water was seemingly endless and the shower pressure was perfect! The place was super clean and easy to find/enter. The dedicated parking spot was well shaded and located right in front of the tiny house (plenty of room for our sprinter van). The location was THE BEST (we walked downtown to restaurants/stores often). The host was very friendly and responsive. I highly recommend staying here- it was an experience our family will never forget (the kids were so bummed we had to leave â€œtheirâ€ tiny house). We will definitely stay again the next time we visit Sandpoint!

We chose to use both the loft bed and the futon bed as two adults used to having a little more space at night and slept well. Mike is a very friendly and accommodating host. He checked in with us regularly and responded quickly to a couple of questions we had. Sandpoint is a destination worth putting in your travel list. The town is charming and walkable and progressive while staying quaint and naturally beautiful. Our friends came for vacation from Florida and purchased a condo to return to immediately upon their return home! Thank you, Mike, for a wonderful stay. I highly recommend this affordable and comfortable and memorable home and experience!

This was a delightful stay, in a delightful property, in a delightful town. I arrived on the Amtrak at 2:30AM, but Mike was super helpful with directions and the door access code. The house is cute but very functional with everything you might need. I especially liked the outdoor grilling area and the additional coffee beans with grinder and multiple brewing methods. The loft is cosy, the AC is cold and the WiFi (after a brief tweak from Mike) is fast. The location is great for the wonderful food and drink options in Sandpoint, and only 10 mins walk from the beach- so refreshing to jump in the lake on a warm day.
This is a new property with a couple of small outstanding snag items, but Mike is hugely receptive to getting everything in perfect condition ASAP. I hope that I can come back some day soon.

April 2024
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: Wow, what a spectacular view! I decided to spend the night here (versus a chain hotel) before an early morning flight from GEG (Spokane Airport). And I'm so glad I did. As soon as I stepped out of the vehicle, my jaw just dropped. The town and the lake were nestled below us, and it was such an idyllic setting. While I selected the cabin for the view, the interior was equally impressive. The decorations and furnishings all felt like Idaho, and it was evident that the owners wanted to showcase their state and town (e.g., an Idaho license plate and Mickinnick Trailhead sign). It's so wonderful to see the pride of place! The cabin exemplifies the best of Airbnb. A minor side note about Sandpoint is that trains run through the town during all hours. However, this setting in the hills is much better for noise-sensitive individuals than one in the valley. Overall, it was a superb experience and well-run accommodation.

review_text: Nice clean studio. We only stayed one short night, but it was comfortable. Great views, nice, clean, modern, and private studio, even though the owners are right next door. They had made a nice bonfire by the time we arrived in the evening. Everything was clean, comfortable and in good working order. Apart from the dogs, we had no interaction with the hosts. There seem to be a lot of friendly but big and rumbunctious off-leash dogs around, so if those scare you, make sure to communicate with Erika beforehand (not sure they were all theirs or not)! What we assume to be their dog, a beautiful Irish setter or setter mix, was very very keen to give an enthusiastic welcome. There were train horns that sounded quite loudly from the foot of the hill in the early evening, but I did not hear any between 11 pm and 6 am, when everything was extremely quiet. Lots of deer around!

review_text: Erika and Alex's place was a top-notch stay! It is exactly how it is pictured in the photos: clean, spacious, stellar views, and all the comforts of home plus a little extra. The place was spotless on our arrival and Alex left us a message when the place was ready for check in. The hosts are very responsive-they live next door and may see them from time to time. We loved staring out the windows at Lake Pend O'Rielle every morning with our coffee that was provided in the home. We truly appreciate dog friendly stays and our hosts were very gracious letting us walk our dog around the property. It is just enough out of town to get that mountain living feel and only a 10-15 minute drive to restaurants and shops. It was about a 25 minute drive to Schweitzer mountain. We would love to stay again and really appreciated having a "home away from home." You will not be disappointed in this stay!

name: Brian
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Great place near the heart of downtown Sandpoint. Being a lower floor unit it was great to have a walkout patio to enjoy the pool area. We were there for the 4th and were able to enjoy the fireworks from the lawn area by the water (at night in the summer wear bug spray for the mosquitoes!). We are a small family of 4, two almost teens and us two adults, and for the summer sleeping was fine. If we all 4 were to be here throughout the day (colder weather) it would be a small space but it worked for us since we were outside most of the day. Thank you for the portable AC unit as it kept the space nice and cool in the triple digits outside. Parking was a plenty even on the holiday weekend. Bedroom bed was quite comfortable. Hideaway was decent. Thank you for the blackout curtains off the patio for the hideaway sleeper use. There were some minor footsteps from neighbors above but not much of an issue. There are docks and a few stairways into the lake but no beach area if thatâ€™s what you are after. You can still swim out here at the lake or drop a kayak or floaty. Due to the heat during our stay we didnâ€™t walk to town, we just hopped in the car and parking in town was pretty easy. You could walk but you walk through the back of a gas station and a gap lot to where the sidewalk begins. Iâ€™ve been a bit random on this review but just wanted to add info that may be of interest to others. Enjoyed our stay on Pend Oreille!

Bathroom fully stocked with shampoo, conditioner, soap, towels. Kitchen fully stocked with olive oil, pans, even a blender to make smoothies! review_text: It is a lovely little condo with wonderful Amenities. We did arrive to no heat and tried for a couple hours to warm the condo with a space heater and a couple wall heaters. We only got it up to 55 degrees. But a call to Kara quickly remedied the problem, since something needed to be reset in the heater. I wish we had called sooner because the condo then heated up very nicely. The modern look and extras are what made this condo a lovely place to stay. The pictures donâ€™t quite show how small the place really is. And there are a couple steps in the condo as you first come in. You have to go up those stairs to access the living room and kitchen. The entrance is a bit crowded by the washing machine and dryer which doesnâ€™t give the best first impression. But the bedroom, bath, living room and kitchen are lovely spaces and well decorated. The condo is well stocked and very clean. One surprise though was having to strip our own linens and towels and start a load of wash. Normally this would not phase me, but we paid a hefty cleaning fee and still had to do this.

review_text: The awesome - This condo is great for a couple. Not so much if you have a baby. So if it was just us I would give 5 stars. Super clean, stocked with all you need and the access to the lake and pool are amazing. Quick responses from penny., the host which was helpful. This place is a great great getaway for the romantic couple. The â€œokayâ€, which is why I have it 4 stars....The condo does have stairs in the unit so for a crawling baby - no bueno. If the unit was bigger, a flight of stairs would be no problem, but with little space for crawling and hang out, it makes it tough to block it off. I would suggest this host recommended that the unit isnâ€™t really suited for infants / babies. And the upstairs unit is LOUD. Really really loud. You can hear people walking, flushing toilets and showering.... and conversations. To be expected with an older condo building, I totally get it. So again, if it were just us then we can deal. But for sleeping baby. Eh...... all in all, a great space for us, just not is with baby.

review_text: Recently remodeled, stylish, and well appointed condominium. Kitchen nice and fully stocked. Nice pool, and complex is on the lake with dock for boats. Kayaks and a bike available from owner. Close to downtown. We really enjoyed our stay. Things to consider: Itâ€™s a small single bedroom unit. Not a lot of room to spread out so best for a couple. We had our teen daughter and pullout sleeper sofa worked well but takes up most of living area. Being summer we could expand the living space to lovely deck with dining and seating options overlooking pool and view of lake. If it were winter Iâ€™d feel a bit confined. Also no air conditioning and while we loved the heat and sun during our stay, the condo gets quite warm. Ceiling fan in bedroom helped greatly but if youâ€™re used to AC be prepared. Sandpoint is great and this was excellent home base to explore. Go to Evans Brothers Coffee on Church Street for your daily caffeine needs. Five minute bike ride away. I think Sweitzer was about a 30 minute (summer) drive. Silverwood water park about 50 minutes.

The place was clean and had everything you could need. It is slightly small, we were four people and this place is better for 2 or 3. The only thing that was missing was some storage space in the living room. We had two people sleeping on the pull out couch and they had nowhere to put their stuff other than the bedroom which is kind of awkward. The patio was great, had lovely dinners out there. We did have a few minor issues (spotty internet and a flat bike tire) but Mike was quick to respond and did what he could to help. I would definitely stay again. The renovations they have done to the place are lovely as well.

Joey was proactive with communication and extremely responsive. There was a little welcome note and snack basket waiting for us and the home was big enough for us to have my parents and sister over for dinner but also felt cozy and homey for the two of us. I really appreciated the countertop space and bathroom size too. A lot of the homes in Sandpoint are a little older so the bathrooms always have limited countertop space, the showers can be tiny and the bathrooms are just smaller overall. But that wasn't the case with Joey's, it was the perfect amount! We 100% want to stay here again when we come back to visit our family in the future!

review_text:
Joeyâ€™s Garage Getaway is a clean, comfortable and conveniently located property in the middle of Sandpoint. It has a well designed floor plan.
It is the perfect size for two adults as a one bedroom. You are within walking distance of all of Sandpoint attractions, restaurants and shops.
Joey, our host, was friendly, quick to respond and went above and beyond for all of our needs and questions.
We asked if he had a humidifier for the property. We told him it was not a big deal if he did not. He promptly responded that he did and would place it outside of our door within 15 minutes. Joey delivered a brand new, top of the line, personal humidifier at our doorstep.
We parked our car on the street during a snow storm. The plow came by and plowed us in. As we were shoveling our car out, Joey came by, grabbed a shovel and helped us free our car.
This property and Joey are great for visitors to the Sandpoint community. He was our favorite host. We will be back.

Stayed about a week
review_text: Joey's apartment is perfect. Neat, clean, thoughtfully designed, little touches of hospitality throughout. My husband and I were visiting Idaho from Virginia to receive medical treatment from a Doctor in CDA, and chose to stay in Sandpoint to be away from the hustle and bustle of the larger city. CDA was an effortless (and pretty) 40 minute commute to our appointments throughout the week and coming back to Joey's apartment each day was a retreat. The apartment is located on a very quiet street, yet walking distance to everything downtown Sandpoint has to offer - especially two grocery stores! The very private hot tub was such a relaxing treat; what better way to start the cool mornings relaxing in the hot tub with a cup of Evans Bros. Coffee Joey so graciously provides? Perfection! The balcony off the bedroom was wonderful for an afternoon cocktail or two. Everything about the apartment was so comfortable and welcoming! For those mornings we didn't feel like making breakfast, we loved Connie's Cafe - every meal delicious! We would not hesitate to stay at Joey's Garage Apartment again - highly recommended! Thank you, Joey; job well done. ğŸ‘

He provided coffee beans, tea bags, seltzer, and welcome snacks, which was a nice "extra." And the hot tub was perfect for after skiing! We sill definitely plan to stay here whenever we visit Sandpoint.

I felt like we had the best of both worlds. We were very close to all things we needed but I also felt like we were a world away up there. The eagles in the tree were amazing. The train that periodically came by reminded me of my childhood home. We had a storm come in the first night. The treehouse was pretty noisy during that. It didn't bother me at all. I thought it was pretty cool. My husband ended up needing some earplugs to sleep well so maybe pack some of those. You won't regret coming here.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This amazing treehouse, right on the bank of Lake Pend Oreille, is the best airbnb I've experienced in my 10 years of traveling. Becky gave me a tour when I arrived. I was in incredulous delight because there were so many artsy, unique, and thoughtful touches. The photos are great, but experiencing the space as a whole was an entirely different level of charm and whimsy. The decorating and restoration of antique furnishings and appliances is brilliant . I especially loved the bronze -fronted fridge (which held organic o.j., homemade raspberry jam, cheese, eggs, and English muffins. I slept like a baby in the cozy, comfy loft bed. There are lots of high quality toiletries, guest bathrobes, and great reading material such as a book of treehouses of the world. There are binoculars to focus on the bald eagles and osprey near the lake. I ended up spending most of my time in the living room or on the porch of the treehouse, just soaking in the panoramic view. I didn't want to leave to go visit anywhere else. And I didn't want to leave when my check-out time rolled around. I'll be back, but next time for a longer stay!

name: Brandon
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
May 2020
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The pictures do not do this place justice.
The location has a quaint, rustic, and wonderfully cozy feel. The views of the lake are breathtaking and awe-inspiring, and it's such a wonderful and welcoming place. We mainly interacted with Becky, who was the picture perfect hostess, even going so far as to give us banana bread as a parting gift! We even stayed an extra day, and Jon was super chill and helpful when it came to pushing our stay forward.
The main thing this place has going for it is its uniqeness. Nobody you ever known has ever stayed in a place quite like this, and I even took a video on my phone to show folks back home. "Wow" and "where is that??" were the universal reactions to the video. The kitchen is fully stocked, down to even a blender, and fresh greens, orange juice, and local coffee beans, in the fridge, and more besides. It's hard to put into words how lovely our stay was there, and we'd undoubtedly do it again.
The one thing I would say is that the location was not quite as private as we were expecting. It is located on the family's property, and they often have children and grandchildren visiting, so even though the main house is a good 75 yards from the treehouse, the dock is right in front of the treehouse, so if you're there on a romantic weekend, don't plan on just strutting around naked like you own the place, as there are many large windows and absolutely no curtains. This isn't a knock against the place, though - merely something we didn't quite get from the listing. I'd still recommend it in a heartbeat. We're extremely pleased. :)

name: J
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
September 2019
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Expect to be thrilled!! It is a beautiful treehouse right on the lake. Well maintained landscaping. Be prepared to walk aways through wet grass from your car to the treehouse. As you probably have read, the stairs are part spiral and part straight-up both outside and in. I got the hang of it pretty quickly, but don't bring a ton of luggage or bags (especially if you are solo) or it will be a struggle. They have everything you need kitchen-wise--no toaster oven or regular oven, but there is a stovetop and a microwave. The bed and a closet are all that is on the second floor (wonderful bed!) so, if you get up often in the night you will have to carefully go down the steep stairs to the very cool galley bathroom! There is a floor above the bedroom as well, where you can look out through the trees at all the beauty, or it makes a great meditation area--very steep ladder to get up there.
All in all, I had a wonderful solo trip--it isn't far from town at all for dining out and shopping in Sandpoint--I love their food coop right on the edge of town, there is a spa on the way to town (Highland) if you would like a massage or facial, etc., and so much more!
I would love to go back to the treehouse next year--it is so unique!

review_text: Wow! The treehouse looked great in the pictures but is even better when you get there. The grounds are meticulously cared for, lush, green and beautiful. The treehouse itself is just amazing. So many little touches and so functional for such a unique space. We loved the top lookout floor for reading with the breeze coming in through the windows. The bed was very comfy. The lake is right at your feet and we loved the use of the private dock with kayaks and paddle boards each day. There are also natural stone stairs leading into the lake if you don't want to jump off the dock for a swim. This place is so peaceful and private. The hosts were great and on our second night during a wind and thunderstorm Hailey even texted us offering to have us hang out with them at their place if we felt unsafe, which was very thoughtful. We chose to stay in the treehouse during the storm which was a pretty cool experience in itself! We stayed for three nights and were so sad to leave. Every minute we spent here was relaxing and joyous, such a wonderful place!

The 2 night reservation in the treehouse was a gift from my husband for my 64th birthday. It will go down as one of the most memorable. Hailey greeted us upon arrival to guide us to the treehouse Hailey is so welcoming and very laid back..her personal touch (fresh fruit bowl & fresh flowers) add a special welcome as you walk thru the door. The beautiful stained glass door (glass compliments of Ireland) immediately tells you..this is a treehouse like no other! For me, it was jaw dropping beautiful..hand carved wooden couch with overstuffed pillows and windows that offer a panoramic view of the beauty that surrounds you. Seated right on the lake you can sit on the porch to enjoy sunrise/sunset; or, walk down to your own private beach and dock.
California king bed guarantees a good night's sleep..you don't need to bring your own pillow from home, the ones provided are perfect. Inside and out the treehouse is a once in a lifetime adventure.

Being right on the lake was perfect for a relaxing weekend - you can enjoy a cup of coffee and watch the sunrise from the porch or living room, sit on the dock, or kayak on the lake. Jon gave an informational tour when I arrived of the history of the treehouse and a run down of some things to do in the area - he was a gracious host and helpful as I began to plan out my weekend. I would highly recommend staying at the treehouse - it is a once in a lifetime opportunity and Jon and Becky couldn't have been more kind and welcoming!

review_text:
Great location, great place. BUT the bathroom was disgusting, there were no cleaning supplies and the owner living on site wasn't available during my entire 4 night stay. I had to buy my own cleaning supplies.
There is no curtain over the sink in the kitchen making it able for you to look in the owners bathroom....
But they can also look right back at you and if you're (semi) undressed walking around they will see you. The lack of privacy made me very uncomfortable.
Hot water heater is too small, I was warned upon check-in but that doesn't make it better. Install a normal water heater for heavens sake. The shower head puts out a huge amount of water and if you shower on full blast you will not last with that water heater. A water saving shower head would be a better match with this tiny water heater.

review_text:
As good as advertised! Fantastic location thatâ€™s easy to walk to all the cool stuff. The inside was minimalist, but very clean and perfect for a solo person or a couple.
Brad was responsive, accommodating, and a great communicator. I ended up losing a key and he took care of it right away.
The entrance is a bit goofy because itâ€™s through the alley and it gets pretty muddy, but no big deal. The trick with the rain shower is to not have it on full blast as you will run out of hot water quickly.
Overall, one of the best values in town and highly recommend!

name: Katherine
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
February 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Bretâ€™s place was a great getaway for a long weekend of skiing, and we were also able to bring our dog! The location was perfect â€” a short jaunt into town for restaurants, groceries, and cute shops.
Finding the stay was straightforward enough, and check-in was a breeze. Having the garage for our car and ski stuff was a huge plus as well. We had no problem parking an SUV in there.
The place itself was simple and had everything we needed to be comfortable including shampoo/conditioner/soap, kitchen essentials for eating, and extra towels and linens. It was super clean upon our arrival, and the shower was a wonderful treat after a long ski day, although the hot water tank is on the smaller side. The bed was comfortable, temperature control was easy, and the TV was a nice way to decompress.
Bretâ€™s communication leading up to the trip and during our stay was fantastic. He was easily reachable, and his replies were always timely and informative.
Overall, Iâ€™d definitely recommend it!

The bed was very comfortable, the shower was lovely. We were advised to be judicious using the hot water. We had no problem having enough hot water for two showers a day in 5 days of staying there. The lighting was great in the rental. The sliding glass door gave us some fresh air. Bret responded to any needs we had and he communicated very well checking to see if we had all that we needed. We liked the place so much that we're going back in June!
